details.excerpt: Last week was another week spentmostly on, what has now almost evolved into a[winged word](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wingedword), building robots. The collaboration with GDS seems to go very well including lots of GitHub interaction.
details.content:
Last week was another week spentmostly on, what has now almost evolved into awinged word, building robots. The collaboration with GDS seems to go very well including lots of GitHub interaction.

Stuart was, in fact, visiting them andworkedon publishing data for Open Data Certificates a lot of this week. Besidesdisappearing into a OAuth rabbit hole,JamesandSamhad a successful week in building our new platform.

Tomwas working on more research strategy and plenty of networking. He also started to receive interesting applications for theCommunity Engagement Manager role (closesby 12 noon on Monday 19th August 2013).

Jeniworked on our response to the HMRC consultation on opening up the VAT register. Shealso presented at a seminar at the Home Office on Thursday afternoon and caught up with the Open Standards Challenges.

Jeni and I also spent some time on how to furtherdevelop the peer-to-peer lending project. The rest of my timewas spent preparingfor theRtraining for Scottish Government statisticians and then actually holding itonedayin Edinburgh. The slides, on their own, are here:Scotland-R-training-2013-08-07.pdf.

Lastly, on Friday we had anOffice Tidy Up â€“ our desks are clean again.
